name: places/ChIJj-NDjmVZwokRukSFUjhUpL4
formattedAddress: 1 Jane St, New York, NY 10014, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1 Jane St, New York, NY 10014, USA

originalText.text: First time visiting Gloss Lab yesterday. Overall the process for scheduling an appointment was seamless. The check in was super quick and I was able to get in right before my appointment which was nice. Jennifer was super meticulous and did amazing work cleaning up my nails. She was quick but was by no means sloppy. The check out was the best, your card is already on file so they are able process your card and add tip without you having to think about it or even take your wallet out. Will definitely be coming back for another Seamless Gel Manicure !

originalText.text: Just got charged $98 for the most basic gel manicure I’ve ever gotten because of a mandatory 20% tip they wont mention until after the service is complete plus the cost of “simple designs” that they charge $4 per nail for but are not even done well. I don’t mind tipping but it should be based on the service received. The technician cut my nail bed pretty bad while trimming my cuticles so now I have bleeding open cut. None of the nail designs are symmetrical to the opposite hand and the cherry on top is after they charge you these ridiculous prices they have the nerve to ask if you want to buy a package for an additional $120.

originalText.text:
I got this done about 6 hours ago and the polish is already tearing and chipping. I suspect my nails weren’t prepped or cured correctly because the gel is soft and dents when I press on it. I got this done via classpass and had to pay a 20% tip (which I don’t mind, but I wish I had the option to choose the amount anyway). Without classpass the cost of a gel mani is $55 (not including the $11 forced tip) which is about $15-20 more than normal for a gel mani in nyc.

Edit: 2 hours after my original post (8 hours after I got the manicure), whole nails of polish started flaking off

originalText.text:
I prefer here to the other nail chains in NY.

If you're like me and hate sitting and waiting for your gel nails to soak off, this is the place for you. They have a special polish that takes gel off without soaking. Idk how more places haven't switched to this method but I can't go back.

They have a pretty good selection of colors and have high quality polish.

Their pedicures are also very quick and efficient if you prefer that to the spa soak and massage type of treatment.

originalText.text: My first time here and Noemi did a great job. She took off my old polish that I got done somewhere else and maintained my nail strength and length. She worked efficiently but didn’t rush or sacrifice quality.
